Description: Under a global bankruptcy settlement lodged in federal bankruptcy court in Manhattan, Tronox Inc. and its affiliated debtors agreed to pay $270 million into trusts and to federal and state agencies that will fund the cleanup of contaminated sites in 22 states.
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/united-states-announces-global-environmental-bankruptcy-settlement-tronox

Description: Tronox, a spinoff of Kerr-McGee, agreed to pay $17 million to local businesses and the school district in Hattiesburg, Mississippi to resolve allegations of creosote contamination.
Private Litigation Case Title: Moucha, et al v. Kerr-McGee Corp, et al
Info Source: https://www.lawyersandsettlements.com/settlements/08473/tronox-settlement.html [apparently drawn from: Creosote lawsuit settled for $17 [sic], Hattiesburg American, June 23, 2007 (via Nexis)].
